comment: Class isn't mandatory but you won't be able to pass the class if you don't show up. Aside from the mandatory 3 exams, he has practice questions but no HW. The test has very little questions so if you get a few wrong, you fail.

I took this professor over the summer online. He was incredibly disorganized, not updating questions to align with the new addition of the book. The due dates on many assignments were incorrect. Doesn't answer emails. It's obvious that most of his content has been stolen from another professor. One of the worst online classes I've ever taken.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: I would absolutely recommend taking Professor Kahn! His lectures are pretty easy to understand however he does not give homework and or any extra assignments so our grade is based on three exams so make sure to be there for lectures. If you have any questions be sure to ask him, he's very nice about helping students understand the materials!

There is no homework or quizzes you have 3 exams and thats it. Final is optional but you can take the final and replace the lowest grade from the 3 exams. He is very entertaining and will answer any questions you have. You dont have to go to class but I would recommend it. He has practice problems on D2L for you but those are optional. TAKE HIM!!

Just for the record, there's 2 David Kahn's at KSU, and they're both in the Econ department... I took David Kahn who teaches 2300 (business stats), and got an A without showing up to class all semester (besides review days).

I took him for ECON 2300, and I can say he was definitely one of the best professors I've had. He is sweet and funny, if you show up to class he will do everything he can to help you succeed. Do not listen to the bad reviews,  just show up, study, ask questions and you will pass!

Very difficult homework with little feedback, and was about 6-8 weeks behind on grading homework at any given time. Poor communication throughout, at least in the online sections. Tests were a lot easier than the homework, but overall, he seemed like he just didn't care.
Do not take! Test averages were around 60% and he told the class we should have studied harder. Half of the class withdrew. He also grades the case studied very hard.

Honestly, this class was super easy. This class consists of quizzes and 2 tests (midterm and final). The only problem was that he was always late opening the quizzes, and you're always left wondering if there will be a quiz or not for the week. Take him if you're lazy and looking for an easy class.
I had him for ECON 4210. He is a wonderful guy and kind. He cares about all his students and does a great job at explaining things in class. Take him you will not be disappointed.

Prof gave a 5 minute online lecture for each chapter then went silent. 10 question quizzes would be uploaded randomly, so basically you read the book and hope for an A. This is an easy, but does absolutely nothing helping me understand macroeconomics. It's not fair to students to provide that little content for a 3 credit hour course. Waste of time
